resources.string: Mood Journal will now be able to receive your phone interaction events such as click, back, home.
Permission required to access interaction with phone.
Just to confirm, we do not collect any sensitive data. We just use this to infer interaction with phone.
Click the button below to open your accessibility settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.
Permission required to access interaction with apps.
We just use this to infer acceptance and dismissal of a notification by checking if the corresponding app was launched.
Click the button below to open your app settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.
Permission required to access interaction with notifications.
Just to confirm, we do not collect any sensitive data.
Click the button below to open your notification settings page. Once you\'re there, enable/reset the app permission and click back button.

Mood Journal app logs your mobility, mood, and phone usage information. Mobility and phone interaction traces are collected in the background. The app samples your contextual information such as location, WiFi connectivity, current physical activity and notification details including arrival time, response time, seen time, sender app name and title. However, to collect your mood logs the app will trigger one mood related questionnaire in a day. All the personal information will be anonymised, and securely transmitted and stored on the server. No additional information related to contacts \(telephone numbers, email addresses etc.\) on your device or history of communication made with the contact made would be collected by the application.
\n\n
The app is developed to collect data for research at University of Birmingham. In order to get your data please enter a valid email address because we will send your data file to the same email address.
\n\n
By clicking \"I Agree\" below, I confirm that I am over 18 years of age and allow the app to collect your data. I also confirm that I am the sole prominent user of this device. I understand that access to any data collected will only be allowed to me and the researchers team at University of Birmingham \(UoB\). Any published results of this study will only refer to anonymised and obfuscated data, and aggregated statistics that do not reveal the identities of the participants. As a participant, I have the right to opt out of the data collection at any time during this experiment by uninstalling the application. Moreover, I have the right to access any information in the data set related to me, and request for any part of that data to be removed.
Enter your MTurk ID. This is used to label the data.

You cannot go back to change your answer. It is not mandatory to completely the test in one go. So, take your time and try to answer the questions as accurate as possible.
\n\n Note that this test uses the Big-Five Factor Markers from the International Personality Item Pool, developed by Goldberg (1992). These big five personality traits that are most commonly used model of personality in academic psychology.
Thank you!

string-array.name: personality_test_questions
string-array.item: I am the life of the party.
I feel little concern for others.
I am relaxed most of the time.
I have difficulty understanding abstract ideas.
I make a mess of things.
I am not interested in abstract ideas.
I am not interested in other people\'s problems.
I get chores done right away.
I often forget to put things back in their proper place.
I do not have a good imagination.
I talk to a lot of different people at parties.
I am not really interested in others.
I change my mood a lot.
I am quick to understand things.
I don\'t like to draw attention to myself.
I take time out for others.
I don\'t mind being the center of attention.
I spend time reflecting on things.
I make people feel at ease.
I am exacting in my work.

resources.string: Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

string-array.name: phq_test_questions
string-array.item: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Feeling tired or having little energy?
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed?

resources.string: Over the last few hours, what is your mood level?

Do you know that mood & emotion really affect the decisions you make every day? In fact, being emotionally aware is really important. We want to help you be more aware of your mood & emotion by creating daily mood reporting as new habit.


Research has shown that forming new habits is easier when you create a strategic plan called implementation intention, by specifying when, where, and how you will execute your goal: "If Y happens, I will do Z!". And this app will guide you setup an implementation intention.


We will start by identifying your existing routine which you will be used as a trigger. Remember that just after the routine occurs, make sure to report your mood immediately. Repeat this process every day.


If you ready to begin, press the button below.
When do you want to report your mood?
After which routine event do you want to report your mood?
Every %1$s, %2$s %3$s, I will report my mood
Please indicate how do you feel about tracking your mood every day. Choose the appropriate response for each item.

You cannot go back to change your answer. It is mandatory to complete the test in one go. So, take your time and try to answer the questions as accurate as possible.
\n\n Note that this test uses HWK Scale to measure goal commitment, developed by Hollenbeck, Williams, and Klein (1989).
Thank you!

string-array.name: gcs_questions
string-array.item: I am strongly committed to pursuing this goal.
I think this is a good goal to aim for.
It would not take much to make me abandon this goal.
Quite frankly, I do not care if I achieve this goal or not.
It is hard to take this goal seriously.

resources.string: Please answer the following questions by choosing the right scale that represents your perception towards completing a mood reporting task as your activity.

You cannot go back to change your answer. It is mandatory to complete the test in one go. So, take your time and try to answer the questions as accurate as possible.
\n\n Note that this test uses SRBAI questionnaire to measure automaticity of behaviour, developed by Gardner et. al. (2012).
Thank you!

string-array.name: srbai_questions
string-array.item: I report my mood without having to consciously remember.
I report my mood without thinking.
I start reporting my mood before I realise I am doing it.
